Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of Harpocrates wearing a pointed hat. Mould-made and hollow. Traces of white coating (?). Red-brown Nile silt with abundant mica. Head fragment from figure or lamp.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Probably from a locally produced representation of Harpocrates of Ptolemaic date. Late 2nd century BC parallel, in a slightly cruder style (Bayer Niemeier 1988, no.22). A simpler variant from Memphis has been dated to the Roman period (Petrie Museum UC47992). Bayer Niemeier, E. 1988, Bildwerke der Sammlung Kaufmann / Liebieghaus Museum Alter Plastik Frankfurt am Main I. Griechisch-römische Terrakotten, Melsungen.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.024) (Phase 3)
